patterns: What types of leukemia are there?
responses: The main types are: Acute Lymphocytic Leukemia (ALL), Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML), Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia (CLL), and Chronic Myeloid Leukemia (CML).
Leukemia is classified as acute or chronic, and by whether it affects lymphoid or myeloid cells. Our AI system can help classify specific cases.
There are four main types: ALL, AML, CLL, and CML. Each has different characteristics and treatment approaches.

patterns: How do I know if I have leukemia?
responses: Common symptoms include fatigue, frequent infections, easy bruising/bleeding, fever/night sweats, bone pain, and swollen lymph nodes.
Symptoms may include persistent fatigue, unexplained weight loss, recurrent infections, and excessive bruising. However, only medical tests can confirm leukemia.
Watch for: persistent fatigue, frequent infections, easy bruising, fever, bone pain, and swollen lymph nodes. Would you like information about our screening services?
Treatment depends on the type but may include chemotherapy, targeted therapy, radiation, stem cell transplant, or immunotherapy. Our specialists can recommend the best approach.

patterns: What medications are used for leukemia?
responses: Common medications include chemotherapy drugs like Vincristine, Prednisone, and Daunorubicin. Targeted therapies like Imatinib and Ibrutinib are also used.
Medications vary by leukemia type. Chemotherapy drugs, targeted therapies, and immunotherapies are common. Our doctors can recommend the best options.
Leukemia treatments often involve chemotherapy drugs, targeted therapies, and immunotherapies. Specific medications depend on the type and stage of leukemia.

patterns: What are the side effects of leukemia treatment?
responses: Common side effects include fatigue, nausea, hair loss, and increased risk of infections. Each treatment has different side effects.

Chemotherapy and other treatments can cause side effects like fatigue, nausea, and hair loss. Our support services can help you manage these.
